summary.p: The manuscript is of Devīmāhātmya. This is part of Mārkaṇḍeyapurāṇa. The manuscript is very hazy. The shelfmark stickers are glued on the last folio so it is difficult to read middle part of the folio.
The end of the manuscript does not match with the published texts of the Devīmāhātmya.
The colophon of the manuscript is not clear it seems that the first letter represents year but the code form is used hence it is difficult to know the exact year. It was written by the Rāmasvami.

handNote.desc: Hazy writing. Could be written by two scribes as the beginning folio has clean and separated characters and the end has hazy writing style.
